visage 0.0.0.9006
  • Reference

Generating random values from the expression

Source: R/zzz_CLOSED_FORM.R
CLOSED_FORM-cash-gen.Rd

This function generates random values from the expression. Random values will be generated independtly as long as they don't share the same symbol in the expression.

Arguments

n

Integer. Number of observations.

rhs

Boolean. Whether or not to keep the right hand side values of the expression.

Value

Numeric values.

Examples


# Constant variable
a <- 1

# Random uniform variable
b <- RAND_UNIFORM$instantiation()

# Define a closed form expression
cf <- CLOSED_FORM$instantiation(~3 * (exp(a) + b))

# Generate 5 values
cf$gen(5)
#> [1] 11.010426 10.170840  8.309093  9.643956  8.982610

# Generate 5 values, and keep RHS
cf$gen(5, rhs = TRUE)
#> $lhs
#> [1] 10.466548  8.811002 10.463364  8.985021  8.666516
#> 
#> $rhs
#> $rhs$b
#> [1] 0.7705676 0.2187189 0.7695063 0.2767253 0.1705570
#> 
#> 

d <- RAND_NORMAL$instantiation()

# Define a closed form expression with another closed form expression
cf2 <- CLOSED_FORM$instantiation(~cf + 3 * d)

# Generate 5 values
cf2$gen(5)
#> [1] 12.288573  9.726809  8.632150  8.160115  6.294046

# Generate 5 values, and keep RHS
cf2$gen(5, rhs = TRUE)
#> $lhs
#> [1] 10.183569  3.295011  8.192305  8.118646  9.922653
#> 
#> $rhs
#> $rhs$cf
#> $rhs$cf$b
#> [1] 0.4157632 0.1571073 0.1563594 0.3454534 0.9743058
#> 
#> 
#> $rhs$d
#> [1]  0.2604779 -1.7770522 -0.1438730 -0.3575198 -0.3850367
#> 
#> 

# Define a closed form expression with two random variables of the same name
cf3 <- CLOSED_FORM$instantiation(~d * d)

# Both `d` will share the same values
cf3$gen(5, rhs = TRUE)
#> $lhs
#> [1] 4.2377404 2.2274887 1.2066247 0.3523011 0.7629823
#> 
#> $rhs
#> $rhs$d
#> [1] -2.0585773  1.4924774  1.0984647  0.5935496 -0.8734886
#> 
#> 

# Define a closed form expression with two closed form expressions of the same name
cf4 <- CLOSED_FORM$instantiation(~cf3 * cf3)

# Both `cf3` will share the same values, both `d` will share the same values as well
cf4$gen(5, rhs = TRUE)
#> $lhs
#> [1] 1.705847e-04 3.959580e-01 2.094124e+01 4.146599e-04 1.204101e-07
#> 
#> $rhs
#> $rhs$cf3
#> $rhs$cf3$d
#> [1] -0.11428390 -0.79325401 -2.13919615  0.14269968 -0.01862798
#> 
#> 
#> 

# Define a closed form expression with two different closed form expressions,
# but contains same random variables
cf5 <- CLOSED_FORM$instantiation(~cf3 * cf4)

# Both `d` in `cf3` will share the same value, but is different with `d` in `cf4`
cf5$gen(5, rhs = TRUE)
#> $lhs
#> [1] 4.613427e-02 8.488113e-04 8.265951e-01 9.417128e-05 2.509453e+00
#> 
#> $rhs
#> $rhs$cf3
#> $rhs$cf3$d
#> [1]  0.4048541 -0.2077578  0.6046373  0.0297952 -1.0970330
#> 
#> 
#> $rhs$cf4
#> $rhs$cf4$cf3
#> $rhs$cf4$cf3$d
#> [1] -0.7283777 -0.3744761  1.2262407  0.5706982 -1.2016692
#> 
#> 
#> 
#>
